result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendall C Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: *Probation review hearing August 26, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. Branch 24.

miscConds.notes:
*No contact with firearms.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.
*No contact with victim J.A.J unless approved by the agent.

*Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
*Batterers Intervention program.
*Parenting classes.

*Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
*Provide DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes:
*6/3/2016 -45 days stayed condition time ordered.   Order for Condition Time signed-To serve three (3) days. Straight time.
*8/26/2016  Order for Condition time signed/filed.  To serve 42 days straight time. No good time credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendall C Long

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR COURT OBLIGATIONS RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant Kendall C Long in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 42 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Kendall C Long in court PRO SE.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation. Court amended JOC to reflect 45 days stayed condition time. Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (3 days straight time). The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim J.A.J unless approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Probation Review Hearing in branch 24.

Defendant Kendall C Long in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Kendall C Long in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

16RM006840  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/06/2016

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JAJ dob 5/6/92 and her child

Defendant Kendall C Long in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Kendall C Long in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
